hanzi-su-wiki:
軌

Значения

Колея, путь; правило, закон

Мнемоника

Колея после проезда девяти 九, т.е. множества телег 車.

Варианты

轨

rtega_mnemonic:
軌軌RS
轨轨		𨊠軓track, rut, path
  • place with bumping 九 cars 車
  • place where cars 車 sail 凡 by
  • kneeling person 㔾 for cars 車 passing by at the track: race car fan
  • a rack railway track 車 (｜ a sleeper, 二 the rails) with the rack (日)'s teeth nine 九 cm apart

(Simplified: 轨)
Pictophonetic: 九 indicates the sound; 車 (cart) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
軌道 [ guǐ dào ]: track (for trains etc); orbit (of a satellite); (fig.) a person's established path in life; desired trajectory (of a business or other endeavor); (audio engineering) track; (quantum mechanics) orbital
軌跡 [ guǐ jì ]: locus; orbit; trajectory; track

heisig_chinese_memo: It takes nine cars to pull the train out of the rut and back onto the rails. &nbsp
heisig_story: Combine the primary and secondary meanings of this keyword to form your story. Begin with the car whose tires get caught in a rut and spin without going anywhere. Then go onto the baseball team who can't win a game because it has fallen into a rut of losing.
myStory:
колея поездов, 9 вагонов

девятый раз везу эту тачку
Keyword_KANJIDIC: rut, wheel, track, model, way of doing
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: гон, колесо, трек, модель, способ сделать
koohiiStory1: My car got so stuck in a rut it required nine people pushing to get it out again.
koohiiStory2: I got my car stuck in a rut ! I´m gonna have to call 999 !
jp_example_words: 軌道(きどう): orbit, railroad track
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: There are nine cars all driving in the same place. With so many cars driving in the same place, they create a rut.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine the cars spinning out in the rut. Spin spin spin. The rut gets bigger. Nine is too many cars.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: To get out of the rut you have to put in a second key (き) that turns on the thrusters. You put in the key and press the "take off" button.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine turning the thrusters key, then feeling the car lift off the ground. You'll finally get out of this rut!
Ru_Meaning: rut, wheel, track, model, way of doing
Ru_trainchinese: guǐ: (сущ) колея, рельсы; правило, порядок
Kanshudo_mnemonic: nine (九) cars (車) in a rut
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Nine cars put together is a train which travels on rails.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " car " to " nine " sound, the original meaning is the distance between the two wheels of the car. "Shu Wen": "Che Che also. From the car, nine tones." "Zhou Li‧ Kao Gong Ji‧ Artisan": "The nine tracks are painted." Zheng Xuan's note: "The track is wide, and the ride is six feet and six inches. Add seven inches to the side, wherever eight feet."

" Rail " can indicate the traces of wheel rolling. "Mencius: Under the Heart": "The rail of the city gate, the power of two horses?" Zhu Xi's notes: "The rail, the rut."

" Rail " also means the axle head. "Poetry‧Beifeng‧There are bitter leaves": "Jiying doesn't push the rails, the pheasants call for their humps." Gao Heng's note: "The rail, the head of the axle."

" Rail " also means car. "Selected Works of Wang Yanshou "Lu Lingguang Temple Fu": "The Gaomen is planned to be in Changhe, and the square two tracks are merged." Li Shan's note: "The second track means that there are two cars."

" Orbit " also refers to the orbit of celestial bodies. "Huainanzi‧ Ben Jingxun": "Five stars follow the track without losing its deeds." Gao You's note: "The track, the way."

" Track " also refers to roads and pathways. Jin Luji "On the Fifth Class of Princes": "There is a name but no reality, the world is open, and the Qin's path will be attacked and destroyed."

" Rail " also means laws, systems, and rules. "Guan Zi‧ Monarchs and Ministers": "Therefore, don't make right and divide that is reason, and that which is reasonable without losing is Tao. Morality is determined and the people are in order."

" Rail " also refers to noble morals. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty-Qiao Xuan Biography": "The old Tai Wei Qiao Gong, Yi De Gao Gui, loves Bo Rong."

" Track " can also mean follow and follow. "Yin Wenzi·Under the Dadao": "The heart is not afraid of the prohibition of the time, and the law of the wrong time is also the way of this chaos."

" Track " is also a kind of ancient household registration system. "Guan Zi‧ Xiao Kuang": "Make five schools as the track, and the track has a long track."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " car ", " nine ", the original meaning is the distance between the two wheels of the car.
humanum_full_description:
從「車」，「九」聲，本義為車子兩輪間的距離。《說文》：「車徹也。从車，九聲。」 《周禮‧考工記‧匠人》：「經涂九軌。」鄭玄注：「軌謂轍廣，乘車六尺六寸，旁加七寸，凡八尺。」

　　「軌」可表示車輪碾壓的痕跡。《孟子‧盡心下》：「城門之軌，兩馬之力與？」朱熹集注：「軌，車轍跡也。」

　　「軌」也表示車軸頭。《詩‧邶風‧匏有苦葉》：「濟盈不濡軌，雉鳴求其牡。」 高亨注：「軌，車軸的頭。」

　　「軌」還表示車子。《文選‧王延壽〈魯靈光殿賦〉》：「高門擬于閶闔，方二軌而並入。」李善注：「二軌，謂容兩車也。」

　　「軌」也指天體運行的軌道。《淮南子‧本經訓》：「五星循軌，而不失其行。」高誘注：「軌，道也。」

　　「軌」還指道路、途徑。晉陸機〈五等諸侯論〉：「有名無實，天下曠然，復襲亡秦之軌矣。」

　　「軌」亦表示法則、制度、規矩。《管子‧君臣上》：「是故別交正分之謂理，順理而不失之謂道。道德定而民有軌矣。」

　　「軌」還指高尚的道德風範。《後漢書‧橋玄傳》：「故太尉橋公，懿德高軌，泛愛博容。」

　　「軌」還可表示遵循、依照。《尹文子‧大道下》：「心不畏時之禁，行不軌時之法，此大亂之道也。」

　　「軌」還是古代戶口編制的一種。《管子‧小匡》：「制五家為軌，軌有長。」
humanum_short_description: 從「車」，「九」聲，本義為車子兩輪間的距離。

Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 九 indicates the sound; 車 (cart) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 車 [ chē ] cart, vehicle; to move in a cart
    • 九 [ jiǔ ] nine
①車子兩輪之間的距離，其寬度爲古制八尺，後引申爲車轍。
②一定的路線：軌跡。軌轍(車輪行過留下來的痕跡，喻已往有人走過的道路或做過的事情)。
③應遵循的規則：軌度(法度)。軌範(規範，楷模)。步入正軌。
軌道 [ guǐ dào ]: track (for trains etc); orbit (of a satellite); (fig.) a person's established path in life; desired trajectory (of a business or other endeavor); (audio engineering) track; (quantum mechanics) orbital
軌跡 [ guǐ jì ]: locus; orbit; trajectory; track

軌道(きどう): orbit, railroad track

從「 車 」，「 九 」聲，本義為車子兩輪間的距離。《說文》：「車徹也。从車，九聲。」 《周禮‧考工記‧匠人》：「經涂九軌。」鄭玄注：「軌謂轍廣，乘車六尺六寸，旁加七寸，凡八尺。」 「 軌 」可表示車輪碾壓的痕跡。《孟子‧盡心下》：「城門之軌，兩馬之力與？」朱熹集注：「軌，車轍跡也。」 「 軌 」也表示車軸頭。《詩‧邶風‧匏有苦葉》：「濟盈不濡軌，雉鳴求其牡。」 高亨注：「軌，車軸的頭。」 「 軌 」還表示車子。《文選‧王延壽〈魯靈光殿賦〉》：「高門擬于閶闔，方二軌而並入。」李善注：「二軌，謂容兩車也。」 「 軌 」也指天體運行的軌道。《淮南子‧本經訓》：「五星循軌，而不失其行。」高誘注：「軌，道也。」 「 軌 」還指道路、途徑。晉陸機〈五等諸侯論〉：「有名無實，天下曠然，復襲亡秦之軌矣。」 「 軌 」亦表示法則、制度、規矩。《管子‧君臣上》：「是故別交正分之謂理，順理而不失之謂道。道德定而民有軌矣。」 「 軌 」還指高尚的道德風範。《後漢書‧橋玄傳》：「故太尉橋公，懿德高軌，泛愛博容。」 「 軌 」還可表示遵循、依照。《尹文子‧大道下》：「心不畏時之禁，行不軌時之法，此大亂之道也。」 「 軌 」還是古代戶口編制的一種。《管子‧小匡》：「制五家為軌，軌有長。」
From " car" to " nine" sound, the original meaning is the distance between the two wheels of the car. "Shu Wen": "Che Che also. From the car, nine tones." "Zhou Li‧ Kao Gong Ji‧ Artisan": "The nine tracks are painted." Zheng Xuan's note: "The track is wide, and the ride is six feet and six inches. Add seven inches to the side, wherever eight feet." " Rail" can indicate the traces of wheel rolling. "Mencius: Under the Heart": "The rail of the city gate, the power of two horses?" Zhu Xi's notes: "The rail, the rut." " Rail" also means the axle head. "Poetry‧Beifeng‧There are bitter leaves": "Jiying doesn't push the rails, the pheasants call for their humps." Gao Heng's note: "The rail, the head of the axle." " Rail" also means car. "Selected Works of Wang Yanshou "Lu Lingguang Temple Fu": "The Gaomen is planned to be in Changhe, and the square two tracks are merged." Li Shan's note: "The second track means that there are two cars." " Orbit" also refers to the orbit of celestial bodies. "Huainanzi‧ Ben Jingxun": "Five stars follow the track without losing its deeds." Gao You's note: "The track, the way." " Track" also refers to roads and pathways. Jin Luji "On the Fifth Class of Princes": "There is a name but no reality, the world is open, and the Qin's path will be attacked and destroyed." " Rail" also means laws, systems, and rules. "Guan Zi‧ Monarchs and Ministers": "Therefore, don't make right and divide that is reason, and that which is reasonable without losing is Tao. Morality is determined and the people are in order." " Rail" also refers to noble morals. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty-Qiao Xuan Biography": "The old Tai Wei Qiao Gong, Yi De Gao Gui, loves Bo Rong." " Track" can also mean follow and follow. "Yin Wenzi·Under the Dadao": "The heart is not afraid of the prohibition of the time, and the law of the wrong time is also the way of this chaos." " Track" is also a kind of ancient household registration system. "Guan Zi‧ Xiao Kuang": "Make five schools as the track, and the track has a long track."

軌字的基本解释

軌
guǐ
见“轨”。

軌字的汉语字典释义

[①]［guǐ］
［《廣韻》居洧切，上旨，見。］
“轨1”的繁体字。亦作“1”。
(1)车子两轮间的距离。
(2)车轮碾压的痕迹。
(3)车轴头。
(4)车子。
(5)天体运行的轨道。
(6)指路轨，轨道。
(7)道路；途径。
(8)法则，制度；规矩。
(9)高尚的道德风范。
(10)遵循；依照。
(11)统计。参见“軌官”、“軌數”。
(12)古代户口编制的一种。
(13)通“宄”。内乱。
(14)通“簋”。
(15)姓。周有轨革。见《尚友录》。

軌字的康熙字典解释

【酉集下】【車字部】　軌； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页1239第06
〔古文〕??【廣韻】居洧切【集韻】【韻會】矩鮪切，?音宄。【說文】車轍也。【孟子】城門之軌。【註】車轍迹也。　又車軸也。【禮·少儀】其在車，左執轡，右受爵，祭左右軌范乃飮。【註】軌，謂轊頭也。又【正韻】法也，則也。【左傳·隱五年】講事以度軌量謂之軌。【前漢·賈山傳】軌，事之大者也。【註】軌謂法度，故凡不循法度者，謂之不軌。　又【正韻】循也。【史記·天官書】星辰軌道。【註】謂循其常道也。【前漢·賈誼傳】諸侯軌道。【註】言循法度也。　又與宄通。【左傳·成十七年】亂在外爲姦，在內爲軌。御姦以德，御軌以?。【註】軌本作宄。　又【儀禮·公食大夫禮】宰夫設黍稷六簋于俎西。【註】簋，古文作軌。　又叶居有切，音九。【詩·邶風】濟盈不濡軌，雉鳴求其牡。　又叶果許切，音舉。【陸機·凌霄賦】削陋跡于介丘兮，省仙遊而投軌。覬情累以遂濟兮，豈時俗之云阻。○按《周禮·冬官考工記匠人》經涂九軌。註：軌，謂轍廣，非。軌卽轍也。《韻會》，輪有高下廣狹，皆定于軌。輪中之軌旣同，則轍

[①]［guǐ］

Traditional characters for "rail 1". Also called "1".
(1) The distance between the two wheels of the car.
(2) Traces of wheel rolling.
(3) Axle head.
(4) The car.
(5) The orbit of the celestial body.
(6) Refers to rails, tracks.
(7) Road; approach.
(8) Rules, systems; rules.
(9) Noble moral style.
(10) Follow; follow.
(11) Statistics. See "rail official", "track number".
(12) An ancient household registration system.
(13) Through "宄". Civil strife.
(14) Through "gui".
(15) Last name. Zhou Yougui leather. See "Shangyoulu".

rail
Name meaning
Nothing.
guǐ
вм. 轨
Radicals: 車, 九  (car, nine)
Meaning Mnemonic
There are nine cars all driving in the same place. With so many cars driving in the same place, they create a rut.
Imagine the cars spinning out in the rut. Spin spin spin. The rut gets bigger. Nine is too many cars.
Reading Mnemonic
To get out of the rut you have to put in a second key (き) that turns on the thrusters. You put in the key and press the "take off" button.
Imagine turning the thrusters key, then feeling the car lift off the ground. You'll finally get out of this rut!
